laazotea.indi.driver

Class INDIFocuserDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIDriver
      • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIFocuserDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser

    public abstract class INDIFocuserDriver
extends INDIDriver
    A class representing a Focuser Driver in the INDI Protocol. INDI Focuser Drivers should extend this class. It is in charge of handling the following properties for Focusers:
    • FOCUS_SPEED -> FOCUS_SPEED_VALUE (number)
    • ABS_FOCUS_POSITION -> FOCUS_ABSOLUTE_POSITION (number)
    • stop_focusing (single switch)
    It is VERY IMPORTANT that any subclasses use super.processNewSwitchValue(property, timestamp, elementsAndValues); and super.processNewNumberValue(property, timestamp, elementsAndValues); at the beginning of processNewSwitchValue and processNewNumberValue to handle the generic focuser properties correctly.
    Version:
    1.34, November 8, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      INDIFocuserDriver(java.io.InputStream inputStream, java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
      Constructs a INDIFocuserDriver with a particular inputStream from which to read the incoming messages (from clients) and a outputStream to write the messages to the clients.

        public INDIFocuserDriver(java.io.InputStream inputStream,

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream from which to read messages
        outputStream - The stream to which to write the messages

    • Method Detail

      • initializeStandardProperties

        protected void initializeStandardProperties()
        Initializes the standard properties. MUST BE CALLED BY SUBDRIVERS.

      • getMaximumSpeed

        protected int getMaximumSpeed()
        Gets the maximum speed of the focuse. Note that 0 is the minimum speed for any focuser. Must be overloaded if the driver uses the FOCUS_SPEED property.
        Returns:
        The maximum speed of the focuser

      • speedHasBeenChanged

        public void speedHasBeenChanged()
        Called when the FOCUS_SPEED property has been changed. Must be overloaded if the driver uses the FOCUS_SPEED property.

        protected void stopped()
        Must be called by drivers when the focuser stops (only when it has been asked to stop)

      • positionChanged

        protected void positionChanged(int currentPos)
        Should be called by the drivers when the focuser its moving. It can be called with any frequency, but a less than one second is preferred to notify the clients of the movement of the focuser.
        Parameters:
        currentPos - The current position of the focuser.

      • processNewSwitchValue

        public void processNewSwitchValue(INDISwitchProperty property,
                         java.util.Date timestamp,
                         INDISwitchElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Description copied from class: INDIDriver
        Called when a new Switch Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Switch Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Specified by:
        processNewSwitchValue in class INDIDriver
        Parameters:
        property - The Switch Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Switch Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • processNewNumberValue

        public void processNewNumberValue(INDINumberProperty property,
                         java.util.Date timestamp,
                         INDINumberElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Description copied from class: INDIDriver
        Called when a new Number Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Number Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Specified by:
        processNewNumberValue in class INDIDriver
        Parameters:
        property - The Number Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Number Elements and its requested values to be parsed.
